introduction: Sixteen-year-old Baha is overjoyed when the girl he loves, Parvina, agrees to let him walk her home.She excitedly shares her family's plans for a holiday in Antalya, a dream that seems unreachable to Baha.When Parvina asks about his family's plans, Baha is cornered, unable to reveal the truth about his father's imprisonment and his mother's struggles as a teacher to make ends meet.From that day on, Baha dreams of the sea, picturing his family happily together on a yacht.By chance, Baha learns the truth about who is responsible for his father's incarceration.Driven by a deep sense of injustice, he embarks on a dangerous quest for the truth, unaware of the risks that await him.
